title: Premium single-product earbuds landing + UPI checkout (frontend)

requirements.summary: Create single-product landing page with Hero, Features, Offer, and Trust sections for “Pro 2 ANC Wireless Earbuds” and ₹1499 (Limited Offer), with Buy Now CTA to checkout.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page renders all 4 requested sections with English copy and the exact product name and price
Hero contains a prominent “Buy Now” button that navigates to (or opens) the checkout page
Features are presented with recognizable icons and short, scannable text
Trust section clearly shows both trust promises: “7 Days Replacement” and “Free Shipping India”

file_operations.description: Create the main app shell and routing wiring for the landing page and checkout page; ensure the landing route renders the 4 required sections and the “Buy Now” CTA navigates to the checkout route.

Implement the landing page with sections in the required order (Hero, Features, Offer, Trust) using English copy, exact product name, and price “₹1499 (Limited Offer)”. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Button, Card, Badge) for premium UI primitives; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the Hero section with headline, price, primary “Buy Now” CTA, and a large 3D-floating-style product visual that uses the generated image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/product-hero.dim_1600x1200.png. Use shadcn-ui Button for the CTA; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the Features section listing: Active Noise Cancellation, Deep Bass Sound, 30 Hours Battery Backup, Touch Control, Compatible with iPhone and Android; include recognizable icons and scannable text. Compose shadcn-ui Card components for feature tiles; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the Offer section emphasizing the limited offer price ₹1499 with a conversion-focused layout and a secondary Buy Now CTA that navigates to checkout. Use shadcn-ui components for typography/CTA styling; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the Trust section with two clear trust badges: “7 Days Replacement” and “Free Shipping India”. Use shadcn-ui Badge/Card styling as appropriate; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add the generated 3D floating earbuds hero render asset (referenced by the Hero section) at the exact path: frontend/public/assets/generated/product-hero.dim_1600x1200.png.
Add the generated dark luxury abstract background texture asset at the exact path: frontend/public/assets/generated/bg-luxury.dim_1920x1080.png.

requirements.summary: Apply a premium dark-luxury Apple-like theme across landing and checkout with soft glow around the product visual; avoid blue/purple as primary brand colors.
acceptanceCriteria: Pages use a consistent dark luxury palette and minimal premium layout
Product visual has a soft glow treatment and subtle depth/3D float effect (e.g., shadow/parallax/tilt/lighting)
No blue/purple is used as the primary brand color

file_operations.description: Create global styles and theme tokens (CSS variables / Tailwind base overrides) to enforce a near-black background, premium minimal typography, and a non-blue/non-purple primary accent (e.g., warm neutral/gold). Apply consistent base styles for landing + checkout.

Create a shared layout wrapper that applies the dark-luxury background treatment using the generated texture at frontend/public/assets/generated/bg-luxury.dim_1920x1080.png and ensures consistent spacing/typography across pages. Use shadcn-ui layout-friendly primitives where relevant; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Enhance the product visual presentation with a soft glow lighting effect and subtle depth (shadow/lighting layers) consistent with the dark-luxury theme; ensure styling does not rely on blue/purple as the primary brand color.

requirements.summary: Add smooth scrolling and premium, performance-optimized micro-animations (reveal on scroll, CTA interactions, subtle tilt/parallax).
acceptanceCriteria: Scrolling between sections feels smooth and consistent
Key elements (hero content, feature cards, offer, trust badges) animate in subtly on first view
Animations do not cause layout shift and remain responsive on mobile

file_operations.description: Enable smooth scroll behavior globally (e.g., via base element scroll-behavior) and define reusable animation utility classes (transition, opacity/transform) that avoid layout shift.
Create a lightweight IntersectionObserver-based hook for section/element reveal-on-scroll animations, tuned for performance and mobile responsiveness.
Create a small, performant hook to apply subtle tilt/parallax interaction to the hero product visual (pointer/motion based), ensuring reduced-motion preferences are respected.
Wire the reveal-on-scroll and subtle tilt/parallax micro-interactions into the hero content and product visual. Ensure no CLS/layout shift and responsive behavior.
Apply first-view reveal animations to feature cards; keep motion subtle and conversion-focused.

Apply reveal animation and premium CTA hover/press micro-interactions (without layout shift). Use shadcn-ui Button states for consistent interactions; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Apply subtle reveal animation to trust badges and ensure animations remain smooth on mobile.

requirements.summary: Create a high-conversion checkout page with customer details, shipping address, quantity selector, order summary, and a clear “Pay with UPI” step.
acceptanceCriteria: Checkout is accessible via a dedicated route/page (e.g., /checkout) and from the “Buy Now” CTA
Form validates required fields (at minimum: name, phone, address, city/state, pincode, quantity) and shows inline errors
Order summary displays the exact product name and computed total based on quantity and ₹1499 unit price
UI is mobile-friendly and optimized for fast completion

file_operations.description: Implement the checkout page UI with required fields (name, phone, email optional, address lines, city, state, pincode), quantity selector, and order summary for “Pro 2 ANC Wireless Earbuds” at unit price ₹1499. Use shadcn-ui Form/Input/Button/Card components to build a clean, mobile-friendly form; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Centralize product constants (exact product name, unit price ₹1499) and total calculation logic based on quantity, to keep checkout summary accurate and consistent.
Wire the checkout route (e.g., /checkout) into the router and ensure navigation from the landing page “Buy Now” CTA reaches it.

requirements.summary: Initiate UPI payment via a UPI intent deep link and render a matching client-generated QR code, with centralized payee configuration.
acceptanceCriteria: Checkout generates a valid UPI payment link (upi://pay...) using the configured payee details, amount, and currency INR
Checkout renders a QR code that encodes the same UPI payment payload
Users can click the UPI link on supported devices or scan the QR to pay
Payee configuration is centralized and easy to update without searching multiple files

file_operations.description: Create a single centralized configuration module for UPI payee details (VPA/UPI ID, payee name, optional transaction note prefix). Ensure it is easy to edit and not spread across multiple files.
Implement utilities to construct the UPI intent payload/link (upi://pay...) from config + amount (INR) + optional note, ensuring proper encoding and a single source of truth shared by both link + QR.

Create a checkout payment step panel that displays a clickable UPI intent link and a QR code encoding the identical payload, using the centralized UPI config and computed order amount. Use shadcn-ui Button/Card for layout and emphasis; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the UPI payment panel into the checkout flow so users see a clear “Pay with UPI” step after completing required details and quantity selection.

requirements.summary: Integrate Motoko canister-backed order creation and retrieval in the checkout flow, showing a confirmation screen with next steps after creating an order.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes a method to create an order and returns a unique order id
Backend persists orders across canister calls (in-canister stable storage)
Frontend creates an order before showing the UPI payment step and retains the order id for the session
Frontend can retrieve an order by id and render a confirmation view that includes order id and amount

file_operations.description: Create a small frontend wrapper around the canister interface (using the core-infrastructure component’s backend connection configuration) to call order-related backend functions. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add order-flow helpers that (1) create an order when the user proceeds to payment and (2) fetch an order by id for confirmation rendering, using the typed backend interface from frontend/src/backend.d.ts.
Update checkout flow to create an order before presenting the UPI payment step; retain the returned order id in session state (e.g., URL param, navigation state, or storage) for follow-up screens.

Create a confirmation view that loads an order by id and displays order id and amount along with next steps text (e.g., complete UPI payment, then enter UTR/reference). Use shadcn-ui components for clear hierarchy; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire a confirmation route (e.g., /order/:orderId) into the router so the checkout flow can navigate to it and users can revisit the confirmation view by id.

requirements.summary: Allow users to submit a UPI UTR/reference for an order, store it, mark status as “payment_submitted”, and show a non-automatic verification success state.
acceptanceCriteria: Checkout/confirmation UI provides an input for UTR/reference (with basic validation)
Backend updates the order with the provided reference and changes status accordingly
Frontend displays a final confirmation screen indicating payment reference received and that verification is pending
The app does not imply real-time/automatic UPI verification

file_operations.description: Create a UTR/reference input form with basic validation and clear helper text stating verification is pending (no automatic verification). Use shadcn-ui Input/Button and inline error styling; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add the UTR/reference submission step to the confirmation view; on submit, call the backend to store the reference and update status, then transition to a final success state.

Create a final confirmation screen explaining that the payment reference was received and the order will be confirmed after manual verification; avoid any implication of real-time/automatic UPI verification. Use shadcn-ui components for clean messaging; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire a final success route (e.g., /order/:orderId/submitted) and ensure the confirmation page can navigate to it after reference submission.
Add a helper to submit the UPI reference for an order (calling the backend submit function) and update cached order state where applicable (e.g., via React Query).

requirements.summary: Add lightweight site navigation (top nav with product name + Buy Now) and a footer with India-focused trust/support text; keep all UI text in English.
acceptanceCriteria: Top navigation is present on landing and checkout pages
Footer is present and styled consistently with the premium theme
All visible UI text is English and matches the product/offer details provided by the user

file_operations.description: Create a top navigation bar showing the product name and a “Buy Now” button that navigates to checkout. Use shadcn-ui Button for consistent premium styling; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a footer with basic India-focused trust/support text in English, styled consistently with the dark-luxury theme. Use shadcn-ui typography primitives if applicable; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire TopNav and Footer into the shared layout so they render on both landing and checkout/confirmation screens.
Wrap all routes/pages with SiteLayout to ensure navigation and footer appear consistently across landing + checkout + confirmation screens.
